arts.ttl: Italiano On Coppa Italia Win: Bologna, Italiano: “We Managed To Make History”
arts.sum: Bologna achieved a historic feat on Tuesday evening, securing a place in the Coppa Italia semi-finals for the first time in 26 years with a hard-fought 1-0 victory over Atalanta. Manager Vincenzo Italiano, known for his prowess in knockout competitions, guided his team to this significant milestone. The post Italiano On Coppa Italia Win: Bologna, Italiano: “We Managed To Make History” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Coppa Italia | Atalanta 0-1 Bologna: Match Report
arts.sum: Bologna etched their name in the history books by securing a place in the semi-finals for the first time this century. The Rossoblu emerged victorious with a hard-fought 1-0 win against Gian Piero Gasperini's Atalanta, courtesy of a late goal from substitute Santiago Castro. The post Coppa Italia | Atalanta 0-1 Bologna: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Atalanta vs. Bologna: the quarter-finals begin
arts.sum: The last time Atalanta and Bologna faced each other in the Coppa Italia was in the 2001/02 season, when in the round of 16 they drew both legs and the Bergamo team progressed on away goals (2-2 in the first leg at the home of the Rossoblù, 0-0 in the return leg). In four of the last six seasons in which Atalanta have participated in the quarter-final stage of the Coppa Italia, they have gone on to progress to the next round, after having been eliminated in their previous five appearances in the final eight.

Bologna have secured the services of Davide Calabria on loan from AC Milan until June 30, 2025. The 28-year-old right-back embarks on his first venture away from the Rossoneri after 11 seasons with their first team. The post OFFICIAL: Bologna Sign Davide Calabria appeared first on FootItalia.com.

Fiorentina have officially announced the acquisition of Nicolò Zaniolo from Galatasaray on a temporary basis with an option to make the transfer permanent. This move marks a return to familiar territory for Zaniolo, who began his youth career in Fiorentina's academy. The post OFFICIAL: Nicolo Zaniolo Joins Fiorentina appeared first on FootItalia.com.
